document.full_text: up to 200,000 deaths from severe malaria could be averted each year if malarial countries were to switch to a more expensive but more effective drug, the medical charity medecins sans frontieres (msf) said tuesday.
document.title: global switch needed on severe malaria drug: msf
lines_and_colors: up to 200,000 deaths from severe malaria could be averted each year if malarial countries were to switch to a more expensive but more effective drug, the medical charity medecins sans frontieres (msf) said tuesday.
